intro: Exohebea lata var. longibracteata, commonly known as the long-bract exohebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheat. The plant is characterized by its upright, branching stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or forested areas.
